channel.title: Homes on Marina Varfolomeeva
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Marina Varfolomeeva
channel.copyright: © Marina Varfolomeeva 2018-present

item.description: I am a Senior lecturer at Department of invertebrate zoology ( Faculty of Biology, St Petersburg State University ). My interests range widely in marine ecology: structure and dynamics of marine communities; role of interspecific interactions in communities; assessment of anthropogenic impact on coastal and marine habitats; microevolutionary processes in sympatric populations of closely related species; methods of statistical analysis.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I teach several courses at Faculty of Biology at St Petersburg State University. Graduate-level courses: Linear Models, Analysis of Variance and Regression Using R (co-instructor Dr.Vadim Khaitov) Multivariate Data Analysis and Visualisation Using R (co-instructor Dr.Vadim Khaitov) Proteomics: Applications, Methods, Data Analysis (co-instructor Dr.Arina Maltseva) Marine Biology (co-instructor) Undergraduate-level courses: Mathematical Methods in Zoology Methods of Zoological Research (co-instructor)
